docs.title: Features
docs.text: Sezo Audio Engine ships as two packages: an Android package for native apps and an Expo module for cross-platform apps with a full iOS implementation and background playback.

docs.title: Feature Highlights
docs.text:
• Low-latency, multi-track playback with sample-accurate sync
  • Pitch and speed control
  • Recording and extraction
  • Background playback (Expo module)
  • Cross-platform JS/TS API with Android and iOS parity

docs.title: Timing and Units
docs.text:
• Sample rate: number of audio samples per second (e.g., 44100 Hz).
  • Frame: one sample per channel. Stereo audio has 2 samples per frame.
  • Position: the engine reports playback position in milliseconds.

docs.title: Tracks
docs.text: Each track is identified by a string id and has a source file path/URI. Tracks can have a start offset (startTimeMs) to align material on the timeline.

docs.title: Synchronization
docs.text: All tracks share a master clock. Timing conversions are handled internally so playback stays sample-accurate across tracks.

docs.title: File Formats
docs.text:
Input formats: - MP3 - WAV

Recording/export formats: - AAC (Android MediaCodec) - MP3 (optional LAME) - WAV (lossless)

docs.title: Threading
docs.text: Audio processing runs on a real-time audio thread. Keep heavy work off the callback and update parameters from a separate thread/UI layer.

docs.title: Extraction
docs.text: Use extraction to render a track or the full mix to a file with effects applied.

docs.title: Extract a Single Track
docs.text:
val result = engine.extractTrack(
  trackId = "backing",
  outputPath = "/sdcard/Music/backing_fx.wav",
  format = "wav",
  includeEffects = true
)

docs.title: Extract All Tracks (Mixdown)
docs.text:
val result = engine.extractAllTracks(
  outputPath = "/sdcard/Music/mixdown.aac",
  format = "aac",
  bitrate = 128000
)

docs.title: Async Extraction
docs.text:
For long exports, use the async APIs and track progress:

  • startExtractTrack(...) returns a job ID
  • startExtractAllTracks(...) returns a job ID
  • cancelExtraction(jobId) cancels the job

Progress and completion callbacks are exposed from the Kotlin wrapper.

docs.title: JitPack
docs.text:
Add JitPack to your repositories:

repositories {
  maven { url "https://jitpack.io" }
}

Add the dependency:

implementation("com.github.Sepzie:SezoAudioEngine:VERSION")

Replace VERSION with a tag like v0.1.2.

JitPack page: https://jitpack.io/#Sepzie/SezoAudioEngine

docs.title: Local Module
docs.text:
If you want to build from source:

  1. Add the module in settings.gradle: gradle include(":engine") project(":engine").projectDir = file("path/to/SezoAudioEngine/packages/android-engine/android/engine")
  2. Add the dependency: gradle implementation project(":engine")

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text:
If you use recording, add:

<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.RECORD_AUDIO" />

docs.title: Android Engine Overview
docs.text: The Android Engine is the native audio core (C++ + Kotlin) packaged as an AAR. It provides synchronized multi-track playback, time-stretching, pitch shifting, recording, and offline extraction.

docs.title: When to Use It
docs.text:
• You are building a native Android app.
  • You need low-latency audio with precise synchronization.
  • You want full control over lifecycle and background playback in your app layer.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• minSdk 24, targetSdk 34
  • NDK 26.1.10909125
  • CMake 3.22.1+
  • Kotlin 1.9+

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Background playback and MediaSession integration are handled by the host app, not the engine.
  • The engine expects file paths (not content URIs). Copy content URIs to a temp file first.

docs.title: Recording
docs.text: The Android engine can record microphone input while playback runs.

docs.title: Start Recording
docs.text:
val outputPath = "/sdcard/Music/recording.aac"
val ok = engine.startRecording(
  outputPath = outputPath,
  sampleRate = 44100,
  channels = 1,
  format = "aac",
  bitrate = 128000,
  bitsPerSample = 16
)

docs.title: Stop Recording
docs.text:
val result = engine.stopRecording()
if (!result.success) {
  throw IllegalStateException(result.errorMessage ?: "Recording failed")
}

docs.title: Formats
docs.text:
• aac (MediaCodec) is the recommended default.
  • mp3 requires LAME support to be enabled.
  • wav is lossless but larger on disk.

docs.title: Build fails with missing headers
docs.text:
Make sure submodules are initialized:

git submodule update --init --recursive

docs.title: JitPack build fails
docs.text:
Common causes: - Missing Gradle wrapper JAR in the repo - Submodules not initialized

Trigger a new tag build after fixes. JitPack uses git tags as versions.

docs.title: Audio file fails to load
docs.text: The engine expects an absolute file path. Copy content:// URIs to a temp file first.

docs.title: Recording returns silence
docs.text: Check that RECORD_AUDIO permission is granted at runtime and that the input device is available.

docs.title: Android Engine Usage
docs.text:
Below is a minimal Kotlin example using the AudioEngine wrapper.

import com.sezo.audioengine.AudioEngine

val engine = AudioEngine()
val ok = engine.initialize(sampleRate = 44100, maxTracks = 8)
if (!ok) {
  throw IllegalStateException("Failed to initialize audio engine")
}

engine.loadTrack("backing", "/sdcard/Music/backing.wav", startTimeMs = 0.0)
engine.loadTrack("vocals", "/sdcard/Music/vocals.wav", startTimeMs = 250.0)

engine.setTrackVolume("vocals", 0.8f)
engine.setPitch(0.0f)
engine.setSpeed(1.0f)

engine.play()

// ...
engine.pause()
engine.stop()
engine.release()
engine.destroy()

docs.title: File Paths
docs.text: The native engine expects an absolute file path. If you have a content:// URI, copy it to a temp file and pass the resulting path.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
const subscription = AudioEngineModule.addListener('playbackStateChange', (event) => {
  console.log('state', event);
});

// Later
subscription.remove();

npm install sezo-audio-engine

<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.RECORD_AUDIO" />

docs.title: Android Engine Dependency
docs.text:
The Expo module links to the Android engine from JitPack by default. Add the JitPack repository to your app:

// android/build.gradle
allprojects {
  repositories {
    maven { url "https://www.jitpack.io" }
  }
}

Optionally pin the engine version in android/gradle.properties:

sezoAudioEngineVersion=android-engine-v0.1.5

If you want to build from source instead, include the local engine module in android/settings.gradle and it will be picked up automatically.

docs.title: iOS Info.plist
docs.text:
If you use recording or background playback, add:

{
  "expo": {
    "ios": {
      "infoPlist": {
        "NSMicrophoneUsageDescription": "Allow access to the microphone for recording audio.",
        "UIBackgroundModes": ["audio"]
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Expo Config
docs.text: The module is built with Expo Modules and is auto-registered by expo-module.config.json.

docs.title: Expo Module Overview
docs.text: The Expo module exposes the audio engine to JavaScript via Expo Modules, providing a single, cross-platform API for iOS and Android.

docs.title: When to Use It
docs.text:
• You want a React Native/Expo API for audio playback and recording.
  • You prefer a single, cross-platform API for iOS and Android.

docs.title: Capabilities
docs.text:
• Multi-track playback with sync, pitch, and speed control.
  • Recording, extraction, and metering APIs.
  • Background playback with Now Playing controls.

docs.title: content:// URIs
docs.text: On Android, content:// URIs are not supported yet. Copy the asset to a file and pass a file:// or absolute path instead.

docs.title: Recording errors
docs.text: Ensure RECORD_AUDIO permission is granted at runtime.

docs.title: Background playback
docs.text: If background playback does not continue, confirm the app is configured with UIBackgroundModes: ["audio"] (iOS) and that notification permissions are granted (Android).

docs.title: Expo Module Usage
docs.text:
import { AudioEngineModule } from 'sezo-audio-engine';

await AudioEngineModule.initialize({ sampleRate: 44100, maxTracks: 8 });

await AudioEngineModule.loadTracks([
  { id: 'backing', uri: 'file:///sdcard/Music/backing.wav' },
  { id: 'vocals', uri: 'file:///sdcard/Music/vocals.wav', startTimeMs: 250 }
]);

AudioEngineModule.setTrackVolume('vocals', 0.8);
AudioEngineModule.play();

docs.title: Recording
docs.text:
await AudioEngineModule.startRecording({ format: 'aac', quality: 'medium' });
const result = await AudioEngineModule.stopRecording();

docs.title: Extraction
docs.text: const result = await AudioEngineModule.extractTrack('backing', { format: 'wav' });

docs.title: Background Playback
docs.text:
await AudioEngineModule.enableBackgroundPlayback({
  title: 'My Song',
  artist: 'My Artist',
  logo: 'ic_launcher',
  playbackCard: {
    smallIcon: 'ic_launcher',
    accentColor: '#0E9F6E',
    showPrevious: true,
    showNext: true,
    showStop: true,
    seekStepMs: 10000,
  },
});
